scoring.5: Returns actual CVEs with correct IDs, severity ratings, affected versions; all from 2024+
scoring.3: Returns relevant security content but some items are older or not official CVEs
scoring.1: Mix of relevant and outdated security information

scoring.5: All results from T1-T2 sources (NVD, Node.js official, security advisories)
scoring.3: Mostly authoritative with some secondary sources
scoring.1: Relies on secondary reporting

scoring.5: Each CVE listed with: ID, severity, affected versions, date, source link
scoring.3: CVEs listed but missing some metadata

tasks.description: Niche topic search requiring domain expertise in query construction
tasks.input: Find research papers and technical reports on using retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) to reduce hallucination in large language models. Focus on evaluation methodologies and quantitative results published in 2023 or later.

scoring.5: Uses domain-specific terminology (RAG, hallucination, LLM); targets academic sources (arxiv, semantic scholar); uses date filters

scoring.1: Uses general terms instead of domain-specific ones

scoring.5: Returns papers specifically about RAG for hallucination reduction with evaluation metrics and quantitative results
scoring.3: Returns relevant RAG papers but not focused on hallucination evaluation
scoring.1: General LLM or RAG papers without hallucination focus

scoring.5: All results are peer-reviewed papers or preprints from reputable venues; citation counts noted
scoring.3: Mostly academic sources with some blog posts
scoring.1: Primarily non-academic sources

tasks.description: Adversarial search with significant noise and SEO spam
tasks.input: Find genuine, unbiased reviews and benchmarks of the top 5 VPN services. Exclude affiliate marketing content, sponsored reviews, and VPN company blogs. I need independent security audits, speed test data from reputable testers, and privacy policy analyses.

scoring.5: Successfully excludes affiliate sites, sponsored content, and VPN company marketing; explains filtering strategy
scoring.3: Filters some noise but includes 1-2 affiliate or sponsored results
scoring.1: Minimal filtering; includes obvious affiliate content
scoring.0: No noise filtering; results dominated by affiliate content

scoring.5: Returns independent security audits (e.g., from security researchers), academic analyses, and consumer reports; no financial ties to VPN companies
scoring.3: Mostly independent but 1-2 sources have potential conflicts of interest
scoring.1: Sources have unclear independence
scoring.0: All sources are financially connected to VPN companies

scoring.5: Includes actual speed test data, security audit reports, and privacy policy analyses with specific findings
scoring.3: Includes some quantitative data but lacks depth
scoring.1: Mostly subjective opinions without data

scoring.5: Uses aggressive exclusion operators (-affiliate, -sponsored, -site:vpncompany.com); targets specific source types (security research, consumer reports)
scoring.3: Some exclusions but not comprehensive
scoring.1: Basic search without exclusion strategy
scoring.0: No strategy for avoiding biased content

tasks.description: Cross-domain research requiring synthesis from diverse sources
tasks.input: Research the intersection of climate change policy, agricultural technology, and food security in Sub-Saharan Africa. I need: (1) recent policy frameworks from international organizations, (2) agritech innovations being deployed in the region, and (3) quantitative data on food security trends. Provide a synthesis connecting these three areas.

scoring.5: Creates 3+ targeted sub-queries for each domain (policy, agritech, food security data) with regional focus; uses appropriate source filters for each
scoring.3: 2 sub-queries but misses one domain
scoring.1: Single broad query attempting to cover all domains

scoring.5: Returns results covering all 3 domains with Sub-Saharan Africa focus; includes international org reports, tech publications, and data sources
scoring.3: Covers 2 of 3 domains adequately
scoring.1: Only covers one domain or lacks regional specificity

scoring.5: Includes T1 sources: UN/FAO/World Bank reports, peer-reviewed research, official government data
scoring.3: Mix of authoritative and secondary sources
scoring.1: Primarily news articles or opinion pieces

scoring.5: Provides a coherent synthesis connecting policy, technology, and data; identifies gaps and opportunities at intersections
scoring.3: Results are organized by domain but synthesis is superficial
scoring.1: No attempt to connect findings across domains
